at the same time, many blackfoot artists also work hard to preserve and promote their cultural heritage. they may study traditional techniques, materials, and designs, and incorporate them into their work. they may also work with community groups and elders to learn more about their cultural heritage and to pass on traditional knowledge and skills to future generations.
